body_html:
I have the same issue, so I thought that I'll drop it here instead of creating a new one. Compiling TF with --config=syscl throws an error:

ERROR: /home/danielius/.cache/bazel/_bazel_danielius/c3436072caa9f5957dc8575117a2d1e5/external/llvm/BUILD:1661:1: C++ compilation of rule '@llvm//:support' failed: computecpp failed: error executing command external/local_config_sycl/crosstool/computecpp -Wall -msse3 -g0 -O2 -DNDEBUG '-std=c++11' -MD -MF ... (remaining 38 argument(s) skipped): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:34:8: error: reference to 'cl' is ambiguous
 static cl::opt<unsigned long long>
        ^
In file included from ./bazel-out/local_linux-opt/bin/external/llvm/_objs/support/external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.pic.sycl:13:0,
                 from <command-line>:0:
external/local_config_sycl/crosstool/../sycl/include/SYCL/predefines.h:88:14: note: candidates are: namespace cl { }
 namespace cl {
              ^
In file included from external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:17:0:
external/llvm/include/llvm/Support/CommandLine.h:48:14: note:                 namespace llvm::cl { }
 namespace cl {
              ^
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:34:8: error: 'cl' does not name a type
 static cl::opt<unsigned long long>
        ^
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp: In constructor 'llvm::RandomNumberGenerator::RandomNumberGenerator(llvm::StringRef)':
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:51:13: error: 'Seed' was not declared in this scope
   Data[0] = Seed;
             ^
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 73.376s, Critical Path: 68.71s

Compiling without --config=syscl works fine.

System information:

  • Ubuntu 14.04 64bit
  • Intel Haswell Mobile graphics / Radeon 8800M

Maybe two graphics cards might be an issue?

body:
I have the same issue, so I thought that I'll drop it here instead of creating a new one. Compiling TF with `--config=syscl` throws an error:
```INFO: Found 1 target...
ERROR: /home/danielius/.cache/bazel/_bazel_danielius/c3436072caa9f5957dc8575117a2d1e5/external/llvm/BUILD:1661:1: C++ compilation of rule '@llvm//:support' failed: computecpp failed: error executing command external/local_config_sycl/crosstool/computecpp -Wall -msse3 -g0 -O2 -DNDEBUG '-std=c++11' -MD -MF ... (remaining 38 argument(s) skipped): com.google.devtools.build.lib.shell.BadExitStatusException: Process exited with status 1.
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:34:8: error: reference to 'cl' is ambiguous
 static cl::opt<unsigned long long>
        ^
In file included from ./bazel-out/local_linux-opt/bin/external/llvm/_objs/support/external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.pic.sycl:13:0,
                 from <command-line>:0:
external/local_config_sycl/crosstool/../sycl/include/SYCL/predefines.h:88:14: note: candidates are: namespace cl { }
 namespace cl {
              ^
In file included from external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:17:0:
external/llvm/include/llvm/Support/CommandLine.h:48:14: note:                 namespace llvm::cl { }
 namespace cl {
              ^
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:34:8: error: 'cl' does not name a type
 static cl::opt<unsigned long long>
        ^
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp: In constructor 'llvm::RandomNumberGenerator::RandomNumberGenerator(llvm::StringRef)':
external/llvm/lib/Support/RandomNumberGenerator.cpp:51:13: error: 'Seed' was not declared in this scope
   Data[0] = Seed;
             ^
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.
INFO: Elapsed time: 73.376s, Critical Path: 68.71s
```

Compiling without `--config=syscl` works fine.

System information:
- Ubuntu 14.04 64bit
- Intel Haswell Mobile graphics / Radeon 8800M

Maybe two graphics cards might be an issue?
